intro: Pfaffia paraguayensis var. typica, commonly known as Paraguay Guarana, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries containing elliptical seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its potential medicinal properties, it has garnered interest in traditional and modern herbal medicine.
